channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.description: Follow news and events as they happen.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.dc:creator: Emma Koehn
item.description: The $8 billion private health insurer says the savings some predicted at the start of the pandemic haven't eventuated.
item.title: Medibank profit slides as claims expenses increase, new chair named

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: Victoria recorded 216 new cases on Wednesday, its lowest daily case total in recent weeks, as mystery cases in NSW continue to concern health authorities.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Victoria records 240 new COVID-19 cases as state's hotel quarantine inquiry resumes; Australian death toll jumps to 463

item.dc:creator: Dominic Powell
item.description: The conglomerate has seen its profits slide after writing down the value of its struggling discount department store chain and taking provisions for its restructuring.
item.title: Wesfarmers takes $500m Target hit as profits slide

item.dc:creator: Kate Rose
item.description: Victoria has recorded 240 new cases of coronavirus and 13 more deaths in the past day, bringing the state's total death toll to 376.
item.title: Victoria records 240 new COVID-19 cases, 13 deaths

item.dc:creator: Patrick Hatch
item.description: Qantas has swung to a $1.9 billion full year after-tax loss after the COVID-19 pandemic forced it to ground most of its aircraft and halt international flights entirely.Â
item.title: Qantas swings to $1.9b loss during 'toughest conditions in 100 years'

item.dc:creator: Alex Druce
item.description: The ASX 200 is expected to dip at Thursday's open, after Wall Street was weighed down by US Fed concerns over the country's economic recovery.
item.title: ASX to slip after Wall Street retreats; $500m writedown for Target

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: Geelong and Richmond are trying to convince the Queensland government they deserve a special exemption to quarantine privately so Gary Ablett and Shane Edwards are ready for finals.
item.title: Cats and Tigers make quarantine bid for Ablett and Edwards

item.description: A Perth pharmacist has been stripped of his registration over his professional misconduct in hazardously dispensing prescriptions for anabolic steroids.
item.title: Perth pharmacist struck off register over misconduct in dispensing steroids

item.dc:creator: Hamish Hastie
item.description: In its submission to the Northern Australia joint committee inquiry into the Juukan Gorge blast, the Banjima group offered rare public commentary on the interplay between traditional owners and miners.
item.title: 'Extreme imbalance of power': Call for recognition of sacrifice traditional owners make to keep WA mining ticking

item.description: Chinese politics students at Princeton University will be given codes to use instead of their names when submitting their work.
item.title: US universities offer Chinese students code names as protection

item.description: The move sets the stage for one of the marquee stockmarket debuts of the year.
item.title: Airbnb confidentially files for IPO, sets stage for blockbuster listing

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: Queensland's Public Advocate has told a parliamentary committee hearing into the pandemic health response the amendments came without either consultation or need.
item.title: 'Criminal or torturous': Government lashed over disability law changes

item.description: Bayern will bid for their sixth European Cup triumph when they come up against Paris St Germain on Sunday.
item.title: Gnabry double sends dominant Bayern into Champions League final

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: A mother, who was told the children saw the whole ordeal, said their school was already organising counselling.
item.title: Schoolchildren 'witnessed' fight to save fishermen from capsized boat

item.description: Adherents contend President Donald Trump is battling a cabal of "deep state" saboteurs who worship Satan and traffic children for sex.
item.title: Facebook says it will crack down on QAnon conspiracy theory, stops at ban

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: Emergency services were called to the home about 11.20pm on Wednesday, with a crime scene declared just before midnight.
item.title: Body found in Toowoomba house after overnight fire

item.description: Russia launched air strikes in Syria in 2015 and began cementing its permanent military presence in 2017, following a deal with the government in Damascus.
item.title: Syria agrees to let Russia expand Hmeimim air base

item.dc:creator: Linda Morris
item.description: Audiences will be temperature checked and asked to mask up as Sydney's mainstage theatre makes a welcome comeback.
item.title: Belvoir pioneers mainstream theatre in a COVID world

item.description: It was a choppy day of trade on Wall Street as the S&P 500 and Nasdaq hit record highs early in the session before the Fed sparked a retreat.
item.title: Wall Street slides from record highs after Fed minutes

item.description: Ocasio-Cortez complained via Twitter that NBC's report didn't appear to recognise the purpose of her 90-second commentary.
item.title: NBC News deletes tweet that Ocasio-Cortez called misleading

item.dc:creator: Rachel Clun
item.description: Premier Gladys Berejklian said people in south-west and western Sydney had to assume they were being exposed to the virus if they were out and about.
item.title: More mystery cases of COVID-19 confirmed in NSW as the state records seven cases

item.description: The US President urged people to boycott tyres from Goodyear, tweeting that the company had "announced a BAN ON MAGA HATS".
item.title: Trump urges Goodyear boycott over its policy on MAGA wear

item.description: Scrambling to control the outbreak, regional authorities have begun to reimpose restrictions on nightlife and public transport that had been lifted weeks ago.
item.title: Spain sets new post-lockdown record for daily coronavirus cases

item.description: Vice-presidential candidate Kamala Harris and her husband Doug Emhoff are early on in their marriage, and America is getting acquainted with them while they're still learning about one another.
item.title: The story of Kamala and Doug, a match made in Hollywood (literally)

item.description: Apple shares have gained nearly 60 per cent this year as customers continued to buy iPhones and other devices online despite the coronavirus pandemic.
item.title: Apple becomes the first US company to be valued at $US2 trillion

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, August 20, 2020

item.dc:creator: Anna Patty
item.description: Australians are being confronted by the cruel side of state border closures which are preventing them from saying goodbye to their dying loved ones.
item.title: 'I feel hopeless': Coronavirus border ban stops visits to dying relatives

item.description: It is obvious why school orchestras are being told to stop playing, while football and pokie machines in pubs continue to be played unrestricted.
item.title: School bands need a lobby group to play

item.dc:creator: Michael Chammas
item.description: In what would be a huge boost for the NRL, the code has requested the NSW government consider an easing of restrictions for its showpiece event.
item.title: NRL wants NSW government to let 50,000 fans into grand final

item.dc:creator: Angus Thompson
item.description: While the redevelopment of the Bondi Surf Bathers Life Saving Club pays tribute to its past, there's one thing its members are happy to bring into the present: the size of the female change rooms.
item.title: Bondi surf club's heritage restoration brings female members into the present

item.dc:creator: Vince Rugari
item.description: An independent analysis has shown the A-League's share of mainstream media 'voice' has shrunk by more than two thirds from its peak since the COVID-19 shutdown.
item.title: The numbers that underline the danger of A-League's winter switch

item.dc:creator: Jennifer Duke
item.description: Prime Minister Scott Morrison is on a collision course withÂ Australia's biggest business lobby groups over international travel restrictions.
item.title: Business groups push to open international borders for economic boost

item.description: Trivia buffs: test your knowledge with today's interactive superquiz and target.
item.title: Target and superquiz, Thursday, August 20

item.dc:creator: Nick O'Malley
item.description: The federal government will further fund research projects seeking to commercialise Australia's mountain of waste.
item.title: Research funded to find ways to turn our waste into dollars

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: The University of the Sunshine Coast is running the next phase of a trial of a COVID-19 candidate developed by US-based company Novovax.
item.title: Chance for SEQ residents to trial COVID-19 vaccine candidate

item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Knight
item.description: Shareholders will be delivering a verdict on Pahari's conduct and the board's judgment.
item.title: The real reason Boe Pahari still has support at AMP

item.dc:creator: Nick O'Malley
item.description: The animal is also at risk in NSW, Queensland and Tasmania.
item.title: Platypus should be listed vulnerable in Victoria, says scientific panel

item.dc:creator: Jessica Irvine
item.description: Don't expect the Reserve Bank to move on official rates, but borrowers have the power: they can vote with their feet.
item.title: Want an interest rate cut? Do it yourself

item.dc:creator: Cara Waters
item.description: The government will only make limited changes to the regulations governing the franchising sector despite a damning report last year calling for widespread reform.Â Â
item.title: Government to limit franchising reform despite damning report

item.dc:creator: Mike Foley
item.description: The national farm lobby's new policy backs Australia achieving net zero emissions by 2050, a more ambitious goal than the Morrison government's agenda.
item.title: Farmers want net zero emissions, going further than Morrison government

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: New analysis of about 2300 fines doesn't address concerns raised by lawyers and human rights groups about the potential for unfair targeting of certain communities.
item.title: Young men are the most likely to cop COVID-19 fines

item.dc:creator: Melissa Singer
item.description: After two months of spreading joy to residents living in lockdown, a jogger dressed in a Spider-Man costume has unmasked himself.
item.title: Solved: The mystery of Melbourne's 'Spider-Man' jogger

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Thursday August 20

item.dc:creator: Lucy Stone
item.description: Disiane Zan and Gabriel Seger say Mr Seger, a Brazilian living in New Zealand, was denied a travel exemption because he was "not immediate family".
item.title: Gold Coast woman faces giving birth alone with partner stranded in NZ

item.dc:creator: Harriet Alexander
item.description: A whistleblower priest was preparing to give evidence about concealing sexual abuse when he received a summons from the Vatican, according to a new book by Suzanne Smith.
item.title: 'What are you planning to say?' Pope quizzed whistleblower priest, book claims

item.dc:creator: Cara Waters
item.description: Stroke prediction startup See-Mode has secured a $USD7 million ($9 million) from investors including Australia's biggest venture capital fund Blackbird
item.title: Stroke prediction startup See-Mode secures $9 million investment

item.description: People are flocking to online book clubs as a chance to connect to other book lovers and talk about something other than COVID-19.
item.title: Aussie book club hub launches as reading love grows

item.dc:creator: Pru Goward
item.description: Woe betides the manager who tries to manage underperformance. A complaint against a supervisor can tie up resources and lead to months of sick pay.
item.title: It's our time to be nimble but our public service is stifled by a culture of complaint

item.dc:creator: Brian Yatman
item.description: The Sydney Railway, a cure for deafness, and the age of oysters.
item.title: In the Herald: August 20, 1855
